data.title: Looking for an onion burger?
data.text: Kept seeing their onion burger sign and finally stopped when they were open. Picked up an onion cheeseburger to go and took it home. The burger was okay, not exceptional.  The price was okay for the burger and better than burger king so for that reason if I was hungry for a burger I would probably pick this instead.

data.title: Not Very Greek Anymore
data.text:
The food was so salty I had to wash it down with 2 cups of Coke.  The waitress and owner were very friendly, but there is no one Greek working there since the old owner sold it to a guy who has BBQ day there once a week.  

If you want authentic Mediterranean food, I would look elsewhere.

data.title: Great food
data.text: Love this place, the food is always wonderful and the people who run this are friendly, just wish they are open for dinner, its hard to go to this place when there hours are so limited.

data.title: What Moore Has Been Needing
data.text:
Great Greek food isn't something that is very apparent in Moore, OK. So, when The Greek Taverna came along, it received a warm welcome. 
The Food - For our first visit, my wife and I got the Chicken Souvlaki and The Gyro Plate and we were very pleased, to say the least. Our entrees were made fresh and their homemade fries were absolutely amazing. The Chicken Souvlaki was seasoned so well and the flavor was incredible. The pita bread with the gyro was soft, warm and easily folded for perfect little spoons for my gyro. 
The staff was very helpful and friendly. They recommended various items in which they enjoyed and it was overall a great experience. I cannot wait to go back and bring my daughter. 

Things To Consider: 
- This place is SMALL. Large parties, probably not your best place. 
- Hours are irregular and they are CLOSED for the remainder of the summer (2015)
- Try to go at non-peak hours for more personal service. (But definitely go one way or another).

data.title: Best Greek food in Moore and beyond
data.text:
Great food , best around  in the Okc metro area. 
Prices are great and everything tastes good, wish they would stay open longer at night, close at 7 pm and closed on weekends!!

data.title: Quaint Little Greek Place!
data.text: Yummy gyros meat as well as chicken and pork!  The regular is huge but they also offer a jr. which is still plenty!  It's one of those places where I'd like to go down the menu list and try it all!!

data.title: Authentic Greek
data.text: In the very center of Moore "old town" sits a tiny Greek Taverna.  The menu is a bit limited, but what they offer is authentic Greek food ... and very delicious.  If you want to practice your Greek, the proprietors will be happy to help.  They are wonderful, happy people - just like you might find in a taverna in Greece.  It's very informal, ideal for lunch or an informal dinner.  Many tavernas in Greece offer "Λίγο από όλα" (bit of everything).  The Greek Taverna in Moore doesn't have that on the menu, but after we left the first time we realized they had done that for us.  The proprietor kept offering us different things to taste ... all of them absolutely delicious.  It was a wonderful experience.  We were on a short visit to Moore and managed to visit one more time before leaving town.  I hope you will try this great little restaurant; you won't regret.
